page.title: 14Gainsborough Court
page.content: The Gainsborough Court{warden {assisted flats for the elderly}were opened in June 1983 . The complex which,cost Â£750,000 to build,consists of a television room , snooker room laundry room , guest room , lounge , kitchen and{35 flats}which house 42 people . Each flat is equipped to make life as easy as possibe for the old people living there and every room has an intercom and alarm to summon {the warden , Mrs.Davies},in case of emergency. In the evening the residents watch television , play the piano ,play darts , cards , snooker or attend the nearby Freshbrook Community centre. Most of the residents are very happy with care and facilities provided by the centre which is part of the West Swindon development.
